Module jtamaro
Package jtamaro.graphic

Class Colors

java.lang.Object
jtamaro.graphic.Colors
public final class Colors extends Object
Static methods for working with Colors, and static fields for well-known Colors.

  • Method Details

    • rgb

      public static Color rgb(int red, int green, int blue)
      Returns a fully opaque Color with the given red (R), green (G), and blue (B) values.
      Parameters:
      red - red component [0-255]
      green - green component [0-255]
      blue - blue component [0-255]
      Returns:
      a Color with the provided RGB components

    • rgba

      public static Color rgba(int red, int green, int blue, double opacity)
      Returns a Color with the given components for red (R), green (G), and blue (B), and a certain degree of opacity (opacity, A).
      Parameters:
      red - red component [0-255]
      green - green component [0-255]
      blue - blue component [0-255]
      opacity - opacity (opacity) of the color, where 0.0 means fully transparent and 1.0 fully opaque.
      Returns:
      a Color with the provided RGBA components

    • hsl

      public static Color hsl(double hue, double saturation, double lightness)
      Returns a fully opaque Color with the provided hue (H), saturation (S), lightness (L).

      Parameters:
      hue - hue of the color [0-360]
      saturation - saturation of the color [0-1]
      lightness - the amount of white or black applied [0-1]. Fully saturated colors have a lightness value of 1/2.
      Returns:
      a Color with the provided HSL components

    • hsla

      public static Color hsla(double hue, double saturation, double lightness, double opacity)
      Returns a Color with the provided hue (H), saturation (S), lightness (L), and a certain degree of opacity (opacity, A).

      Parameters:
      hue - hue of the color [0-360]
      saturation - saturation of the color [0-1]
      lightness - the amount of white or black applied [0-1]. Fully saturated colors have a lightness value of 0.5.
      opacity - opacity (opacity) of the color, where 0.0 means fully transparent and 1.0 fully opaque.
      Returns:
      a Color with the provided HSLA components

    • hsv

      public static Color hsv(double hue, double saturation, double value)
      Returns a fully opaque Color with the provided hue (H), saturation (S), value (V).

      Parameters:
      hue - hue of the color [0-360]
      saturation - saturation of the color [0-1]
      value - the amount of light that is applied [0-1]
      Returns:
      a Color with the provided HSV components.

    • hsva

      public static Color hsva(double hue, double saturation, double value, double opacity)
      Returns a Color with the provided hue (H), saturation (S), value (V), and a certain degree of opacity (opacity, A).

      Parameters:
      hue - hue of the color [0-360]
      saturation - saturation of the color [0-1]
      value - the amount of light that is applied [0-1]
      opacity - opacity (opacity) of the color, where 0.0 means fully transparent and 1.0 fully opaque.
      Returns:
      a Color with the provided HSVA components.
